attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to submit himself for sectioning and psychiatric treatment under the mental health act 1983 

Submitted by John Rogers – Deadline to sign up by: 2 December 2009

Category: Health, well-being and care

More details:

People with different types of defined "mental disorder" can be admitted to hospital against their will under the Act. 

These include those with "severe mental impairment", "psychopathic disorder" or "mental illness". 

A patient can be sectioned if they are perceived to be a threat to themselves or other people.

We are very concerned that the Prime Minister is a threat to himself and the general population of the United Kingdom and should for his own health and well-being be sectioned under the mental health act.

Initially we suggest that he should be detained under section 136 - Mentally disordered persons found in public places and then assessed for detention under section 3.

Sectioning under 136 can be undertaken by the policeman conveniently located at the front door of number 10.

reasons: Language which is offensive, intemperate, or provocative
